review_title: Good place to start a career.
pros: Friendly staff, a good environment and support from the management.
cons: They need to improve the work balance because it can be too demanding.

review_title: Good team but skills not utilised
job_title: Small Pet Care in Godmanchester, England
pros: Team was good to work with, all wanted the best for the animals. Got to work with some lovely animals and gained experience with new species.
cons: Physically demanding, hired due to previous experience but then not trusted to do anything other than clean until you had been there 6 months.

review_title: Shameful what the people at the top are doing
pros: The volunteers are so lovely to work with
cons: Absolutely clueless at running a charity business more lining their pockets
Ran by people seeing it as business, not a charity

pros:
Some people are really like minded and passionate about animal welfare.
Spending time with animals for work is mostly enjoyable.
Very basic healthplan - could claim 3 prescriptions a year etc.
cons: Toxic work environment, staff were childish and treated it like a school playground whilst managers were too busy/uninterested to try and actually manage people. Welfare was not a priority, numbers were. Welfare was compromised for filming the doghouse. Pay rises were promised for 3 years in a row, never to be seen. Minimal progression opportunities and recruitment process was biased and unprofessional. Dogs were brought into kennels despite not having enough staff to take proper care of them, sometimes resulting in a deterioration in behaviour ending with the dog being put to sleep. Always understaffed. Very little respect towards staff and no empathy or care when anybody was ill, they would just be pressured to return to work ASAP. Major improvements need to be made, almost half the dog team left in the space of a few months. Really low pay whilst the 'higher ups' earned over 3x what the Animal carers earned.

Honestly, it has changed so much in the last few years. It has become a lot more number based, the care for the animals has gone down hill dramatically. Management took away so many responsibilities and don't trust there employees who have worked there 5+ years. It became extremely boring, with management not feeling the need to change things to keep people, turn over is horrific. You're either over worked with not much care from management, just get the job done, or you're trying your best to find jobs. God forbid you make close friends there, they will split you up if you like working together

review_title: Only good thing is the dogs
pros: Working with the dogs each day
cons: Weak leadership, poor pay and bad culture

job_title: Senior Care Assistant in Newtownabbey, Northern Ireland
pros: Lots of good colleagues to work with good team work
cons: Management team is very unhelpful and doesn't do anything to help you

pros: Working with pets around the site.
cons: Leadership is clueless and out of touch.

pros: Good team to work with. Good experience, very helpful manager.
cons: Shop was never very busy so could be standing around sometimes.

pros: Some lovely animals and some staff are lovely.
cons:
Poor pay, except for the top few who get thousands of pounds in bonuses a year.
Terribly ran from top to bottom.
A vast majority of managers get their jobs through sucking up to the right people, rather than through merit.
Sexiest managers that give better opportunities to males.
An awful, biased HR department that have little to no HR knowledge and therefore "lose" complaints etc as its easier than dealing with them.
Managers are promoted into jobs that were not advertised.
Huge workload. If you dare to say anything, you are told to manage your time better.
Managers will pull together to bully people out.

pros: They make it sound so good in the beginning, then the true colors come out.
cons: They make you travel all these different places. They Tell you to do this and do that and expect you to make miracles every day!  Management does not listen to you when you voice your concerns. I would never recommend this place to anyone! Do not let them hype you up to be extremely disappointed in the end!

review_title: Great animal charity to work for, focused on giving the highest quality of care to pets in need
job_title: Deputy Site Manager in London, England
pros: Does take in all sorts of animals, including the sick ones/less rehomeable ones, which other charities avoid helping as much as possible
cons: High staff turnover due to low salary pay

review_title: Came for experience, stayed for community
pros: The managers and other volunteers make me want to stay longer.
cons: Quiet surprising considering the central location.
